auckland.title: Sky Tower
auckland.body: Take the elevator up the top for views and a glass floor. There is also a revolving restaurant near the top!

auckland.title: Auckland Museum
auckland.body: Museum with NZ history, natural history, as well as military history. There are also botanical gardens, walking areas and great views.

auckland.title: Viaduct Harbour
auckland.body: An attractive area to walk around with many restaurants, cafes and boat tours. The nearby Wynyard quarter sports many restaurants and occasional outdoor activities.

auckland.title: North Shore beaches
auckland.body: There are many beaches along the North Shore, and many of them are lined with cafes, restaurants/bars and small shops.

auckland.title: Mt. Eden
auckland.body: Mt. Eden is a dormant volcano near central Auckland that can be driven or walked up. It is the highest land in Auckland, and as such, has great landscape views.

auckland.title: Devonport
auckland.body: The Devonport area is an attractive suburb on the water with many shops and cafes. You can get there via car or even ferry from the city!

auckland.title: Waiheke Island
auckland.body: A short ferry ride from Auckland city, this island is full of vineyards, wineries, breweries and beaches. A must do.

auckland.title: Rangitoto Island
auckland.body: Rangitoto is a dormant island-volcano in the Auckland harbour. It is accessible only by ferry and has a few different hiking trails. The summit is gorgeous and overlooks the entire area.

auckland.title: West Coast Beaches
auckland.body: These beautiful, rugged black-sand beaches with strong surf are great for hiking, walking and (for the bold) surfing.

auckland.title: Auckland Bridge
auckland.body: This bridge is one of the main thoroughfares into and out of Auckland city. But why drive over it when you can climb it or jump off it?

dayTrips.title: Hobbiton
dayTrips.body: Visit the gorgeous set from Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit that is also a working farm and boasts a functioning pub at the end.

dayTrips.title: Goat Island, Matakana Markets & Vineyards
dayTrips.body: Drive up north, taking the scenic route and enjoying the beautiful country! Stop in Matakana, on Saturdays they have a great market. At Goat Island you can swim, snorkel, hike or just relax! After, stop by the Leigh Sawmill for great food and drinks. There are also vineyards in the area.

dayTrips.title: Waitomo Caves
dayTrips.body: Take a boat ride through the caves to see the famous glow worms, or try something more adventurous like tubing through the caves!

dayTrips.title: Karangahake Gorge Historic Walkway
dayTrips.body: Cliff faces with sheer drops, native bush, gushing waterfalls and a river. Cross the swing bridge and go for a walk (long and short options). Learn about some goldmining history, discover stunning waterfalls before heading to The Talisman Café for a bite to eat.

dayTrips.title: Kitekite Falls
dayTrips.body: Hike to one of NZ’s most famous waterfalls with a swimming hole!
